perturbation.original_text: 8.2      Applicable Law. This Agreement and the rights and duties of                   Transporter and Shipper hereunder shall be governed by and                   interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of                   Arkansas, without recourse to the law governing conflict of                   laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2      Applicable Law. This Agreement and the rights and duties of                   Transporter and Shipper hereunder shall be governed by and                   interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of                   Delaware, without recourse to the law governing conflict of                   laws.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the applicable law from Arkansas to Delaware introduces uncertainty, as the contract's enforceability depends on consistent and relevant state law. If the contract involves Arkansas-specific regulations, changing the state to Delaware creates a legal contradiction and impedes proper legal interpretation, making the contract difficult to enforce, due to relevant precedents being different.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law principles

perturbation.original_text: 8.6      Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire                   agreement between Transporter and Shipper concerning the                   subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior understandings                   and written and oral agreements relative to said matter.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6      Entire Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire                   agreement between Transporter and Shipper concerning the                   subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior understandings                   and written and oral agreements relative to said matter. However, any verbal agreements made after the signing of this contract may or may not be subject to enforcement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states that the written agreement supersedes all prior agreements. By adding 'However, any verbal agreements made after the signing of this contract may or may not be subject to enforcement,' introduces a contradiction. It creates ambiguity about the validity of verbal agreements, contradicting the 'entire agreement' clause and undermining the contract's enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: All written notices, requests, statements or other communications shall          be sufficiently given if mailed postage prepaid by registered,          certified, or regular mail and shall be deemed to have been duly          delivered on the third business day following the date on which same          was deposited in the United States mail, addressed in accordance with          this Article VIII.
perturbation.changed_text: All written notices, requests, statements or other communications shall          be sufficiently given if mailed postage prepaid by registered,          certified, or regular mail and shall be deemed to have been duly          delivered on the third business day following the date on which same          was deposited in the United States mail, addressed in accordance with          this Article VIII. If the communication involves any type of litigation, then it will only be properly delivered if it is sent via telepathy.
perturbation.explanation: The first clause defines how proper communication can be completed. By adding 'If the communication involves any type of litigation, then it will only be properly delivered if it is sent via telepathy' creates ambiguity. It is impossible to send a formal legal notice via telepathy which will cause confusion and undermine the enforceability of the legal communication. Therefore, it creates a legal contradiction.
